summary: A letter from defense attorney Bobbi Sternheim to Judge Alison Nathan detailing an incident at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) where guards confiscated Ghislaine Maxwell's confidential legal documents and intimidated her, allegedly violating her Sixth Amendment rights. The letter includes email correspondence with MDC legal counsel and a formal demand to preserve evidence.

events.title: Legal visit and document confiscation incident
events.description: During a legal conference at MDC, guards confiscated Ghislaine Maxwell's confidential legal documents after her attorneys left, accused her of a serious infraction, and later a guard stood over her while she used the bathroom.

events.title: Email exchange regarding incident
events.description: Sophia Papapetru emailed Bobbi Sternheim alleging Maxwell received unauthorized documents; Sternheim responded disputing the allegations and demanding document return and information.

events.title: Letter to Judge and preservation demand
events.description: Bobbi Sternheim sent a letter to Judge Nathan detailing the incident and alleging Sixth Amendment violations, and sent a formal notice to Sophia Papapetru demanding preservation of evidence related to the incident.

events.title: Court order to show cause
events.description: Judge Nathan ordered MDC legal counsel to show cause by April 28, 2021, why an order directing the MDC to provide the information requested in Sternheim's letter should not issue.

keyFacts: MDC guards confiscated Ghislaine Maxwell's confidential legal documents, including materials subject to a protective order and attorney-client privilege, after a legal visit on April 24, 2021.
A guard stood knee-to-knee with Maxwell while she used the bathroom, which she described as intimidating and humiliating, occurring off-camera.
Defense attorney Bobbi Sternheim alleges the actions violated Maxwell's Sixth Amendment right to effective assistance of counsel and have chilled attorney-client communication.
The document includes a court order from Judge Alison Nathan for MDC legal counsel to show cause regarding the incident and a formal evidence preservation notice sent to MDC counsel.
Sternheim disputes MDC's claim that documents were improperly passed to Maxwell, stating all documents were previously received via legal mail and not provided during the visit.
